text.p: Tropical Storm Carlo is passing about 100-150 miles north of the northern Mariana Islands and will cause squally winds and rain over the northern islands this period. Carlo will be a threat mainly to shipping as top winds increase from 50 mph to near typhoon strength by 48-60 hours. The storm will be moving slowly northwestward this period.
Heavy rain associated with the remains of T.D. Beth will continue in Vietnam for 18-24 hours more with local flooding.
Hurricane Lili, with 75 mph winds, is 555 miles east of Bermuda moving slowly to the east and is slowing down. Lili will weaken and become extratropical this period, threatening shipping only.
There are no further statements at this time.
